channel.title: University in America after studying abroad
channel.description: Has anyone here had experience being an American citizen, studying secondary school (high school) abroad, and then returning to the States for University? What are the requirements?

item.title: University in America after studying abroad
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Rictoo, post:7, topic:340448”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=436819.msg3209507#msg3209507 date=1274114720]
I’d like to know how easy is it to get into a American University with an IB diploma and yes, I am an American citizen, but I’ve done my schools in Finland.
[/quote]
That’s not hard, they accept IB everywhere.[/quote]Okay, thanks for telling

Read full topic
item.source: University in America after studying abroad

item.title: University in America after studying abroad
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Teh Spede:

I’d like to know how easy is it to get into a American University with an IB diploma and yes, I am an American citizen, but I’ve done my schools in Finland.

That’s not hard, they accept IB everywhere.

[quote=“Radeon, post:4, topic:340448”]I’ve had the same experience, except I’m an Australian citizen returning to Australia.

Did you complete secondary school under an American syllabus?

Best thing to do is email the universities with your life story.[/quote]
I will have completed school under a Hungarian syllabus which is more advanced than an American syllabus, but I don’t think they care. I guess I’ll just e-mail every university I can find. Thanks guys.

Read full topic
item.source: University in America after studying abroad

item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I’ve had the same experience, except I’m an Australian citizen returning to Australia.

Did you complete secondary school under an American syllabus?

Best thing to do is email the universities with your life story.
